actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 932. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for consideration of the bill in the Committee of the Whole under an open rule, with the time for general debate to be equally divided between the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. After passage of the bill, it shall be in order to take the bill S. 374 from the Speaker's table and consider the bill in the House. It shall be in order to move to strike out all after the enacting clause and insert in lieu thereof the provisions of H.R. 932, as passed by the House. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-288, by Mr. Gordon.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 69.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 932) to settle all claims of the Aroostook Band of Micmacs resulting from the Band's omission from the Maine Indian Claims Settlement Act of 1980, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 932 (Aroostook Band of Micmac Indians).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 932) to settle all claims of the Aroostook Band of Micmacs resulting from the Band's omission from the Maine Indian Claims Settlement Act of 1980, and for other purposes.
